intro: Lamprolobium, commonly known as the golden burr, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its spiny, seed-bearing structures that resemble small, inflated balls. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance. Lamprolobium species are often found in South Africa, where they thrive in sandy or rocky soils.
